data.title: The terminal process exited with code 1 - Can't open terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode
2. Press Ctrl+` to open integrated terminal
3. The message "The terminal process exited with code 1" is displayed always (attached)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19211868/17568089/dad6d29e-5f4a-11e6-88f5-3a3b96f5bd2f.png)

data.title: Selected text in high contrast mode is not readable in Edge browser
data.body:
When in high contrast mode using Edge, selected text remains white with the selected white background making it unreadable.

Here is selected text in Chrome:

And here is the same selected text in Edge:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5246869/17568024/cb25b5da-5f0f-11e6-9f24-3cf2ba5a893a.png)

data.title: Integrated terminal cannot scroll
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 64 using i3 Tiling Window Manager
- HP dv6 (laptop) trackpad 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the integrated terminal.
2. `cat` a long file
3. The terminal does not scroll.

data.title: node debugger does not stop on 'debugger' keyword
data.body:
- VSCode Version: v1.4.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. clone `https://github.com/mattkime/node-test-debuggers`
2. run `npm run vscode`
3. run the debugger

data.title: \n replace with \n not recognized when regex replace
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.5.0-insider
- Date: 2016-08-08
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Put in the following text
   `Fashion axe organic man bun you probably haven't heard of them.\nUllamco next level tofu kitsch skateboard. \nId  helvetica kinfolk synth, flexitarian viral aliquip proident chicharrones nihil sriracha.\nShabby chic man bun beard, labore cred everyday carry adipisicing meditation sint  dolor  single-origin coffee.\nPork belly ullamco swag, pug twee delectus nihil.`
2. Control+H  to enter replace dialogue. 
3. Enable regex replace
4. Type `\n` as the regex match
5. Enter replacement text as `\n` to enter lines breaks
   Result: Nothing happens. 

Expected result: 

```
Fashion axe organic man bun you probably haven't heard of them.
Ullamco next level tofu kitsch skateboard. 
Id  helvetica kinfolk synth, flexitarian viral aliquip proident chicharrones nihil sriracha.
Shabby chic man bun beard, labore cred everyday carry adipisicing meditation sint  dolor  single-origin coffee.
Pork belly ullamco swag, pug twee delectus nihil.
```

Allow the \n match to be replaced by actual line breaks. This reproduces behavior consistent with other text editors such as Sublime. 

To currently get it to work you have to double escape like this `\\n`

data.title: How do I make a command that only appears in the command pallet when my extension is loaded?
data.body:
I'd like to some commands that only appear when a Dart project is open (eg. my extension is activated). If I add a command to `packages.json` it seems to always be available in the command pallet. (These commands are equiv of `nuget restore` etc., you wouldn't want them visible when you open a Perl project, for example).

I'm sure I'm missing something; but I just can't figure out how to control this :(

data.title: Suggestion: Automatically show the Problems panel if problems exist (and hide similarly)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6

I often work with the Problems panel open, as listing the problems that way is a very good visual indication of what needs some work. However, when I don't have any current problems, it'd be nice if the Problems panel could automatically hide (giving some more screen real estate). Then, when problems come up, it could automatically show again.

A little bit of auto-sizing based on the current number of problems would also be nice, but is less important, in my opinion.

data.title: ability to bind ctrl+shift+i and override other Chrome shortcuts
data.body:
Is it possible to add the ability to override Chrome keyboard shortcuts? For example, I would like to bind `ctrl+shift+i` to a command, but it always opens up the developer tools instead.

(vscode 1.4.0, Win8.1)

data.title: Holding the down arrow key doesn't send repeated keypress to integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6 El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal.
2. Use `git log` in a git project directory
3. Hold down arrow key to scroll down.

Only one line movement occurs, and key has to be tapped repeatedly.

data.title: Delete a folder from the explorer pane doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows Server 2008 R2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right-click on a **folder** that contains one or more files and folders, and select 'Delete'
2. (You'll be prompted to move to recycle bin)
3. Click 'Move to recycle bin'
4. (Notice that the folder doesn't show up in the explorer anymore)
5. Click the refresh button

Observed:
- The folder comes back, it was never moved to the recycle bin

Note: Deleting a single file works, but deleting a folder doesn't.

After looking more into it... it seems that if there is a problem deleting the folder (due to permissions), VSCode doesn't let the user know, so the problem is about reporting a problem deleting a file/folder.

data.title: Need to be able to set the size of the undo history
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make many changes in a file.
2. Try to undo them. 

I haven't counted but it seems that it will only go back about 20 - 25 changes. I would like to be able to set this higher but don't see a config setting for it.

data.title: Pressing F12 - "Go to Definition" does not work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select function call in code.
2. Press F12 to "Go to Definition"
3. Cursor stays on same place. iMac volume is increased.

data.title: Can't use debug with Powershell scripts using Powershell extension 0.6.1
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Powershell extension
2. Create a new Powershell script (but don't save it)

$a = 'b'
1.  hit f5

Result:

> An error occurred while creating the pipeline.
> At line:0 char:0

Now, save the script and hit f5, result:

> Cannot run a document in the middle of a pipeline: D:\PS\Untitled-1.
> At line:0 char:0

data.title: [Feature Request] Context menu on explorer 'Open folder in Vs Code'
data.body:
The title is self-explanatory 

What do you guys think?

data.title: Can't access a local file in html when I call the API 'vscode.showPreview'
With some files, VS Code cannot find modules that exist
data.body:
Sometimes when I open my project, VS Code is unable to find imported external modules. I've got typings for the modules installed, all files in the project compiles fine using `tsc`, but I get red squiggly lines in the editor. The weird thing is that I get the squiggly lines only for some .tsx files, while it works for others.

The file src/web/App.tsx is fine:
![web](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12714276/17553706/9f148050-5f07-11e6-8721-fd1e3a99cac2.png)

While I get squiggly lines for the file src/native/App.tsx:
![native](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12714276/17553710/a3c8f266-5f07-11e6-9ab0-69ce23c46a0c.png)

My tsconfig.json content is the following:

```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": false,
        "jsx": "react",
        "noImplicitAny": true,
        "experimentalDecorators": true,
        "module": "commonjs",
        "target": "es5",
        "rootDir": "src"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
        "src/native",
        "app",
        "app-native",
        "tools",
        "test"
    ]
}
```

Both `react` and `react-native` are installed as global typings.

Unfortunately, I cannot post the source code right now, but basically, the structure of the source files is as following:

```
src
 |-- common
 |-- native
       |-- index.ts
       |-- App.tsx
 |-- web
       |-- App.tsx
 |-- index.ts (this one is for web)
```
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Any ideas?

data.title: Opening multiple files from file explorer causes new VS code windows instead of files becoming tabs.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Opening multiple files from within file explorer causes each file to open its own VS Code window instead of becoming tabs within a single window. Gif of it in action (files opened after gif cut off): https://gfycat.com/UnawarePepperyBream
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607 (14393.67)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select multiple files within a file explorer (highlight them)
2. Right click and open with code

Expected: Each file opens as its own tab within one VS code window.
Actual: Each file opens its own VS code window.

data.title: Duplicate autocomplete suggestions in latest monaco build
data.body: - VSCode Version: Master - OS Version: MacOSX Steps to Reproduce: 1. Build latest monaco 2. Try autocomplete with any language e.g CSS 3. See duplicates in autocomplete

data.title: Do not terminate active running task when running another
data.body:
It would be nice if there would be ability to run multiple tasks without killing that once already running like in webstorm.
e.g. i Have active gulp watch task but meanwhile i need to run another gulp task (like generate some code) and vscode now suggest me to kill watch task before running another. 

If it possible can you share how because I cannot find anything on google.

data.title: fix clearTimeout
Pressing Cmd-F overwrites find text even if nothing is selected.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enter some find text.
2. Press enter.
3. Edit the text in the document.
4. Press Cmd-F to repeat the search.
5. Notice that the text in the find box has been replaced with the word the cursor is over.

This is really annoying when doing repeated find-edit cycles.

data.title: VSCode Task runner should be able to read scripts from package.json
data.body:
It would be nice if VSCode, if a package.json is detected in the project, reads the scripts from the package.json to run thru the task runner without the need of creating a tasks.json calling the npm run methods.

data.title: Get the editor for a TextDocumentContentProvider provided content
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `Version 1.5.0-insider (1.5.0-insider)` 13b6e6d
- OS Version: `Version 10.11.6 (15G31)`

From a `TextDocumentContentProvider` is there any way to get access to the editor the content will be opened into?

I am trying to apply decorations to the provided content, but I haven't found a reliable (non-hack) way to get access to the opened editor. You can see my hack [here](https://github.com/eamodio/vscode-git-codelens/blob/master/src/contentProvider.ts#L42)

Also is there any way to control the order of "reference" in the peek ui? I'm attempting to hijack that UI to provide git blame history but I can't control the order -- so it will be very confusing :)

Thanks!

data.title: Tabs vanish when using diff view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use vscode with a git repo
2. Change a file
3. go to diff view
4. select file to view diffs
5. Tabs vanish (maybe wanted?)
6. go to workspace explorer
7. tabs are gone as well

The tabs are coming back, as soon as one closes the diff view.

Diff view:
![diff](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/agn3r6rkwi4rxn7/gfsfpnb7.png)

Explorer:
![explorer](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/agn3r6rkwi4rxn7/fycm20em.png)

and as soon as the diff view is closed:

![yay](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/agn3r6rkwi4rxn7/9_umr_ti.png)

data.title: Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly when trying to debug an extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `Version 1.5.0-insider (1.5.0-insider)` 13b6e6d096c479f4174d025d647385054b1e43d7
- OS Version: `Version 10.11.6 (15G31)`

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open any extension and try to debug it
2. Results in `Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly`

This was working perfectly until the latest insiders build.
